page.title: 11Local History (Place Names)
page.content: Information collected by James Shaw & Paul Friel-We asked Mr.G.Short,our local historian to tell us about Place names in Cheadle.BANK ST.-It was once called Low St but in 1819 a Bank was built & the name was changed.MILL RD- -At the bottom there is a stream called Cecily Brook,once there was a Mill there & in 1309 75 families used the Mill to grind their corn.PRINCE GEORGE ST.It was once called Back St. but on July,13th,1934 Prince George came to open the Community Centre,where the Scouts now meet.It was the first school in Cheadle opened in 1685.EAVES LANE-It is called after Eaves Farm, which is 400 yrs. old.WELL ST.It was called Hobbs Lane & was the site of the local well.When the well dried it was renamed Well St.CHAPEL ST. was called Smithy Lane until the Wesley Chapel was built in 1812.
